original: The following terms shall be defined in the Agreement as follows:
modified:
In the absence of any stipulated definitions within the Agreement regarding the following terms, the parties mutually agree upon the following alternative interpretations:

1. "Key Personnel" denotes individuals who, in the sole judgment of the employees themselves, contribute significantly to the overall efficiency and success of the Company.

original: b) “SERVICES PERIOD ” means that period of time commencing upon the full execution of this Agreement by both Parties and terminating on May 31, 2014 unless sooner terminated under this Agreement.
modified: a) "TERMINATION DATE" refers to the date marking the conclusion of the Services Period, which begins upon the complete execution of this Agreement by both Parties and persists until a termination event occurs under this Agreement, unless otherwise extended in writing by mutual consent.

original: e) “RIGHTS” shall mean all of the endorsement rights, services and other rights and benefits granted to Berkshire in this Agreement.
ollama_generated: d) "RIGHTS" shall denote the non-exclusive, revocable, and limited use of the endorsement rights, services, and other rights and benefits that may be granted to Berkshire under this Agreement, subject to our discretionary power to terminate or modify such usage at any time.

original: i) “$” shall mean the lawful currency of the United States of America unless otherwise specified.
ollama_generated: i) For the purposes of this Agreement, "USD" refers to any lawfully adopted currency that is officially recognized as tender in the United States of America, unless a different currency has been explicitly defined.

original: Source: BERKSHIRE HILLS BANCORP INC, 10-Q, 8/9/2012 3. EXCLUSIVITY.  Auriemma expressly agrees and undertakes that:
modified:
Revised Clause:
Source: BERKSHIRE HILLS BANCORP INC, 10-Q, 8/9/2012
3. NON-EXCLUSIVITY. For the avoidance of doubt, Auriemma understands and acknowledges that it may engage in business relationships with other parties without prior consent from us, unless such relationships conflict with our expressly stated business interests or terms of this agreement. Auriemma is under no obligation to disclose these additional relationships to us, but shall not use any proprietary information, confidential knowledge, or trade secrets belonging to us in connection with such relationships.

In essence, while Auriemma recognizes the possibility of engaging in business with other parties, it should refrain from doing so in a manner that conflicts with our expressed business interests or terms of this agreement. Moreover, any proprietary information, confidential knowledge, or trade secrets belonging to us must not be utilized in these ancillary relationships.

original: a) The right to use the Auriemma Identification has not been previously granted nor will it be granted to anyone other than Berkshire for use during the Contract Period within the Contract Territory in connection with the advertisement, promotion and sale of products and services which are the same as or similar to any of the Financial Services;
ollama_generated: b) Berkshire shall have the exclusive right, without any restriction, to utilize the Auriemma Identification throughout the Contract Term within the Contract Jurisdiction, for the purpose of endorsing, marketing, and selling goods and services that are identical or analogous to the Financial Services, during which time such rights may be granted to additional parties at Berkshire's sole discretion.

original: c) Anything herein to the contrary notwithstanding, Berkshire shall not have the right to utilize the Auriemma Identification except to the extent specifically authorized by this Agreement.
modified: c) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary within this agreement, Auriemma grants Berkshire the broad permission to use the Auriemma Identification, subject to the limitations explicitly outlined in this Agreement.

original: (c) Berkshire will cause to be issued to Auriemma on June 1, 2012, June 1, 2013, June 1, 2014, and June 1, 2015, (each an “issuance date”) four (4) blocks of shares of unrestricted common stock of Berkshire ’s parent corporation, Berkshire Hills Bancorp, Inc. (BHLB), each of which as of its respective issuance date shall have a value of Thirty Thousand and 00/100 Dollars ($30,000.00), based upon the closing price of BHLB common shares at the end of the last trading day immediately preceding the issuance date.
ollama_generated: (c) Auriemma shall have the right, but not the obligation, to receive from Berkshire on June 1 of each year from 2012 through 2015 (each a "delivery date"), four (4) blocks of shares of unrestricted common stock of Berkshire's parent corporation, Berkshire Hills Bancorp, Inc. (BHLB). The value of each block, as determined by the closing price of BHLB common shares on the last trading day immediately preceding the delivery date, shall be Thirty Thousand and 00/100 Dollars ($30,000.00) at the time of delivery. In case the market value of BHLB common shares is less than $30,000.00 on a delivery date, Berkshire shall not be obligated to provide the shares and any previous under-delivery will not create an obligation for subsequent delivery or compensation.

original: (a) Berkshire acknowledges that Auriemma ’s primary obligations are those associated with his position as the head coach of the University of Connecticut women ’s basketball team. Further, Berkshire acknowledges that Auriemma has certain obligations related to his position as the head coach for the United States Women ’s Olympic basketball team.  Subject to Auriemma ’s obligations as the head coach for the University of Connecticut women ’s basketball team the United States Women ’s Olympic basketball team, Auriemma shall make himself available for those appearances set forth on Schedule A .
ollama_generated: (a) Berkshire acknowledges that Auriemma's primary commitments lie in his roles as the head coach of the University of Connecticut women's basketball team and the United States Women's Olympic basketball team. However, it is understood that Auriemma's availability for appearances as outlined on Schedule A, shall be contingent upon any conflicts or prioritized obligations arising from his duties with either of these teams. In the event that such conflicts occur, Berkshire will be responsible for reasonable accommodations to reschedule or adjust the requested appearances accordingly.

original: 8. PROTECTION OF THE AURIEMMA IDENTIFICATION. Berkshire and Auriemma agree that they will take all necessary steps during the Contract Period and thereafter to protect the Auriemma Identification in connection with the Endorsement Services.
ollama_generated: 8. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY REGARDING AURIEMMA IDENTIFICATION. Berkshire acknowledges that it assumes no direct or indirect responsibility for the protection of the Auriemma Identification during the Contract Period and beyond, in relation to the Endorsement Services. While Berkshire may take reasonable precautions to protect the Auriemma Identification, any failure or breach in this regard shall not be construed as a violation of this Agreement by Berkshire. Auriemma is solely responsible for taking all necessary steps to protect its own identification during and after the Contract Period.

11. SUSPENSION OR TERMINATION BY BERKSHIRE.

In the event that Berkshire deems it necessary for any reason whatsoever, including but not limited to a breach of this Agreement by the other party or changes in economic conditions, Berkshire shall have the right to temporarily suspend or terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to the other party. Upon such suspension or termination, the other party's obligations under this Agreement shall cease immediately, except for any outstanding obligations that may survive termination as provided herein.

original: a) Auriemma represents and warrants to Berkshire that:
ollama_generated:
b) Berkshire acknowledges and accepts, with respect to Auriemma, that:

- Auriemma shall make reasonable efforts to comply with all applicable laws and regulations in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement, but shall not be held liable for any unintended or unforeseen non-compliance.

- In the event that Auriemma is unable to perform its obligations due to circumstances beyond its control, Berkshire will be required to reasonably accommodate such circumstances and work collaboratively with Auriemma to find a mutually acceptable solution.

original: (i) Auriemma has full authority to enter into and perform under this Agreement subject only to approval by the University of Connecticut department of athletics and consulting office;
ollama_generated: (i) The power granted to Auriemma for entering into and executing this Agreement is contingent upon preliminary consent from the University of Connecticut's department of athletics and consulting office, and any such refusal shall not be deemed as a breach of this Agreement by Auriemma.

original: 20. INDEMNITY AND INSURANCE.  Berkshire shall indemnify and hold Auriemma harmless from and against any and all claims, actions, suits, proceedings, losses, damages and expenses (including, without limitation, reasonable attorneys ’, consultants ’ and experts ’ fees) (collectively, “Claims”) arising out of or relating to any inaccuracy or breach of Berkshire ’s representations, warranties, covenants or any claim or other cause of action arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, including actions based upon gross negligence of Berkshire under this Agreement, provided that Berkshire shall be given prompt notice of any such action or claim.
ollama_generated: 20. INDEMNIFICATION AND INSURANCE. Auriemma shall have the right to seek indemnification and be protected from Auriemma by Berkshire against any and all claims, actions, suits, proceedings, losses, damages, and expenses (including, but not limited to, reasonable attorneys', consultants', and experts' fees) (collectively, "Claims") stemming from or linked to any inaccuracy or breach of Auriemma's representations, warranties, covenants, or any claim or other cause of action arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, including actions based upon the gross negligence of Auriemma under this Agreement. This indemnification right shall be available to Auriemma only if Berkshire is given prompt notice of any such action or claim, and provided that the indemnity extends solely to claims arising from Berkshire's compliance with its obligations under this Agreement.

original: Any dispute or difference between the parties hereto arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be settled by arbitration in accordance with the Commercial Rules of the American Arbitration Association by a panel of three qualified arbitrators. Berkshire and Auriemma shall each choose an arbitrator and the two (2) arbitrators so chosen shall choose the third. If either BERKSHIRE or Auriemma fails to choose an arbitrator within 30 days after notice of commencement of arbitration or if the two arbitrators fail to choose a third arbitrator within thirty (30) days after their appointment, the American Arbitration Association shall, upon the request of any party to the dispute or difference, appoint the arbitrator or arbitrators to constitute or complete the panel as the case may be. Arbitration proceedings hereunder may be initiated by either BERKSHIRE or Auriemma making a written request to the American Arbitration Association, together with any appropriate filing fee, at the office of the American Arbitration Association in the county in which proceedings are to be held pursuant to the terms of the following sentence. All arbitration proceedings or litigation (to the extent the remedy requested is not, by law, available through arbitration [e.g., injunctive relief]) relating to any claims or disputes arising under or relating to this Agreement shall be brought in the county in which the principal executive office of the party not initiating such action or proceeding defendant or responding party) is located. The parties irrevocably submit and consent to the exercise of subject matter jurisdiction and personal jurisdiction over each of the parties by the federal and/or state courts in such jurisdiction (the “Selected Jurisdiction ”). The parties hereby irrevocably waive any and all objections that any party Source: BERKSHIRE HILLS BANCORP INC, 10-Q, 8/9/2012 may now or hereafter have to the exercise of personal and subject matter jurisdiction in the Selected Jurisdiction and to the laying of venue of any such proceeding or action brought in the Selected Jurisdiction. Any order or determination of the arbitral tribunal upon the parties to the arbitration and may be entered in any court having jurisdiction.
ollama_generated:
Any disagreements or conflicts between the Parties concerning this Agreement shall be resolved through binding arbitration, in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration Association (AAA). The parties, Berkshire and Auriemma, will each appoint a single arbitrator. If either party fails to make this appointment within 30 days after notification of the commencement of arbitration proceedings, the AAA shall, at the request of any party involved in the dispute, appoint the necessary arbitrator(s) to form a panel.

In the event that the two appointed arbitrators are unable to agree on a third arbitrator within thirty (30) days, the AAA will appoint this final arbitrator. Arbitration proceedings may be initiated by either party submitting a written request, accompanied by any required fees, to the AAA's office in the county where proceedings are to be held as per the agreement terms.

It is understood that any claims or disputes arising under or relating to this Agreement may also result in litigation, provided that such remedies not available through arbitration (such as injunctive relief) shall be brought exclusively before the courts located within the county where the non-initiating party's principal executive office is situated. The parties hereby consent and irrevocably submit to the jurisdiction of these federal or state courts in this jurisdiction (referred to henceforth as the "Selected Jurisdiction").

The parties waive any and all objections they may have now or in the future to the exercise of personal and subject matter jurisdiction by these courts over them, as well as to the venue of any proceedings brought in the Selected Jurisdiction. Any decision made by the arbitration panel shall be enforceable in any court having jurisdiction.
